subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Paul's keyboard proposal (withdrawn)
msgSnippet: ... I envision a two-step process. First, let s set the standard for Junior QS. The 46 letters under current discussion form a complete catalog of the
messageBody:
On Jan 2, 2008 7:11 AM, Benct Philip Jonsson <bpj@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Moira O'Brien skrev:
>
> > Thanks for the vote of confidence Paul!
> >
> > I have updated my spreadsheet and shown where there is
> > agreement and where disagreement so one can concentrate
> > the mind on only the contentious ones.
>
> You can remove the column BPJ2 since BJP2.1 is merely an
> updated version of it, and supersedes it.
>
> BTW there are half-letter assignments in BPJ1 too.
>
>
> > I have also included ALL the half letters as there are
> > sufficient keys
>
> I can't see why alternate 25 and 36 should be included but
> half-letters excluded. To me they are essentially the same
> thing - and a good thing -, namely alternate letter-forms to
> be used at the writer's discretion to increase the speed and
> flow of writing. As I have said before I'm far from
> convinced that any alternate letter-forms, including half-
> letters, should be part of typographic QS, but I think they
> should be included in any font mapping, since the key phrase
> is "the writer's discretion".

I envision a two-step process. First, let's set the standard for
Junior QS. The 46 letters under current discussion form a complete
catalog of the individual graphemes of the Read Alphabet. Designing
glyphs for this set is the first step in QS font development. (And
yes, technically this set includes letters from Senior QS, but as I've
said before I consider these letters essential members of the alphabet
that should be included at this stage.)

The schedule I've proposed is that we spend January debating and
refining the proposals, and February voting. Once we've succeeded in
setting this standard, we can move on to Senior QS.

Naturally one can plan ahead, as you've done in your proposals. But
please, it's going to be difficult enough to set this standard. Let's
not get ahead of ourselves.

To start off discussion, I'd like to see if we can move our proposals
closer together over the next couple of weeks. Some of the assignments
are fairly independent of the rest. I'd like to start with the
assignments for #21 and alternate #23. I find your suggestion of using
G for #21 and N for alternate #21 to greatly improve readability. I
think these assignments could be adopted in the other proposals with
few, if any, negative ramifications. Peter, Moira, what do you think?

Also, how much interest is there in following the precedent of the
Jerome mapping? If there is not, then perhaps you and I could withdraw
BPJ1 and QS-Up. That would simplify things. What do you think?

If anyone out there is strongly attached to the Jerome mapping, please speak up!

Ted



> > Moira 
> >
> : /|
> : _| | /BP
> : \|
>
